definition: the road to happiness is strewn with setbacks (idiom)
to be fond of/to have a tendency to/to be prone to

sentences.english: But as the saying goes, "good things never come easy", and love is the best of all things.
sentences.chinese: 但是俗话说“好事多磨”，而爱情就是最美好的事物。

sentences.english: This is also part of the Dao.
sentences.chinese: 他说，好事多磨，这也是道的一部分。

definition: the meal is remembered long after the wait is forgotten/the good things in life are worth waiting for
the old man lost his mare, but it all turned out for the best (idiom); fig. a blessing in disguise/it's an ill wind that blows nobody any good
pinyin: sai4 weng1 shi1 ma3 yan1 zhi1 fei1 fu2

definition: bitterness finishes, sweetness begins (idiom); the hard times are over, the good times just beginning
twists and turns
calligraphic flourish with many twists/fig. many twists and turns
to lose at sunrise but gain at sunset (idiom)/to compensate later for one's earlier loss/what you lose on the swings you gain on the roundabouts
pinyin: shi1 zhi1 dong1 yu2 , shou1 zhi1 sang1 yu2

definition: to achieve Buddhahood through one's efforts and insight/to obtain a positive outcome after sustained efforts/to come to fruition
extreme sorrow turns to joy (idiom)
curious coincidence
lit. the willow trees make the shade, the flowers give the light (idiom); at one's darkest hour, a glimmer of hope/light at the end of the tunnel
planning is with man, accomplishing with heaven (idiom); Man proposes but God disposes.
pinyin: mou2 shi4 zai4 ren2 , cheng2 shi4 zai4 tian1

definition: God's plans supersede our own/Man proposes but God disposes
pinyin: ren2 suan4 bu4 ru2 tian1 suan4

definition: two simultaneous happy events in the family
propitious wind throughout the journey (idiom)/plain sailing/to go smoothly/have a nice trip!
the matter depends on the individual (idiom); it is a matter for your own effort/With effort, one can achieve anything.
one is bound for good fortune after surviving a great disaster (proverb)
pinyin: da4 nan4 bu4 si3 , bi4 you3 hou4 fu2
